name: emmet
content:
emmet noun [C]
(insect)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a word used in some parts of the UK and Ireland to refer to an ant (= a small insect that lives under the ground in large, well-organized groups): Not one perished, not even an emmet.
Kaphoto/E+/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesLook at the little emmets crawling around.The people and carriages look like emmets crawling on the ground.

emmet noun [C]
(person)
informal a word used in Cornwall in southwestern England to mean a tourist (= someone who visits a place for pleasure, especially on holiday), or someone who moves to live in Cornwall from somewhere else: This route will be crawling with emmets during the summer months. The proposed "emmet" tax would be ploughed into building new homes for people who are Cornish born and bred.
More examplesFewer examplesJust because a Cornish person calls you an emmet doesn't mean they are not grateful for the boost in the economy you bring to the county.A purist would say that I am an emmet myself, since I have lived in Cornwall for only seven years.
